artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Artist: Miyagi Gengyo; Publisher: Kagiya Shōbei
creditline: Gift of Arthur and Jane Pejsa
description: frowning man with eyes nearly crossed, wearing black and brown plaid and green striped garments; mounted on a thin sheet of paper which is mounted on a board
markings: ULC red artist\'s seal: 城 {Gyo}; LRC red seal of the author
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled actor series with wood tanzaku
signed: LLC in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga} | ULC: 玄魚製 {Gengyo sei} (produced by Gengyo)
text: This is a collaborative work between Utagawa Kunisada, who designed the portrait, and Miyagi Gengyo, who was responsible for the background. On the right is a wooden board inscribed with a poem by the actor Bandō Hikosaburō V (1832–1877), who is portrayed here as the wrestler Onigatake Dōemon, one of the main characters in the play “Champion Sumo Wrestlers Victorious in Two Generations” (Sekitori nidai no shōbuzuke), performed at the Nakamura Theater in 1861. The plot is about a wrestler who is poised to intentionally lose a bout to rescue his lover from prostitution.
title: Actor Bandō Hikosaburō V as the Sumo Wrestler Onigatake Dōemon
